column4: hey everyone I have a ubuntu server that I was working on and i ran a bash command and what happened next I need help with its could not find any files after I ran it. then I tried to reboot it and now I get run-init : /sbin/init: no such file or directory
I ran a mysql backup script but I had change the path and I thought I had not define it
How can I repair the install or is it a format
if you don't show the command or script you ran, the likelihood of someone here fixing your problem is very small
http://shirker.blog.com/2010/03/29/daily-rsnapshot-backup-mysql-db-mysqldump-gzip-rsync/ this and I replaced the BAKRSNROOT=/raid5/mysql_dump with BAKRSNROOT=
I would assume it deleted root right... fail
I failed at setting a folder unintentional
and you ran the script as root i guess?
yeah, thats not good, but there shouldn't really be anything in / that could be deleted like that
if I boot into recovery I have 3 partitions sda 1 titled linux sda2 extened and sda5 linux vm
